title: Thrifty mother-of-one reveals she's bagged £1000 of free goods in two years
text:
A thrifty mum who has received over £1,000 worth of free goods in just two years has revealed her top tips so you can do the same - including 'liking' company Facebook pages.

Ana Maria Macovei, 29, from Essex, told how she has managed to bag everything from beauty products to an £800 mattress and pillow set without so much as spending a penny.

Other items the bargain hunter has got her hands on include a car £350 seat worth £350, a Logitech crayon worth £60 and various food and drink products.

Explaining her clever strategy, she told LatestDeals.co.uk: ‘I mainly apply on the links shared on Latest Free Stuff group.

‘I have also registered to many product testing sites, such as TryIt sampling, Home Tester Club, Clicks Research, Alba Science and Swift Research.'

Ana Maria Macovei, 29, from Essex, told how she has received £1000 of items for free in the past two years. Pictured with her son

The thrifty mother-of-one also told how she hasn't needed to purchase skincare products for years, as she manages to bag them for free

The stay-at-home mum, who applies for freebies every day while her son is taking a nap, can get as many as seven offers in one sitting.

She says one of her biggest tips is to visit testing sites, as they give out full-sized products in exchange for a review, and to sign up for alerts so you can be notified when a not-be-missed offer is released.

'Sometimes they also pay you with Amazon vouchers once you complete a study,' the mother-of-one told the money-saving site. 'I also do surveys – Populus Live is the main one I use as I feel it pays the most.’

However, Ana also warned that anyone keen to follow in her footsteps should be aware of the influx of emails following the sign ups - but advised to set up a separate email address purely for offer applications.

While the mother-of-one gets everything from beauty items and baby products without spending a penny, her most expensive freebie was an £800 mattress and pillow set (pictured)

The saving queen has also managed to be gifted food and drink for free - as well as baby products (pictured)

Ana went on to share other words of wisdom and suggested 'liking' as many posts as you can on social media is key, as this will result in companies targeting you with offers for competitions.

She added: ‘Join LatestFreeStuff.co.uk and the Free Stuff Facebook Group: there is an amazing community of freebie hunters that share offers all the time and also offer advice on what to stay away from (as there are some scammers out there too).'

The saving queen went on to emphasise the importance of keeping on top of product testing invites as it's often first-come-first serve basis - so you need to get in quick.

Not one to miss a trick, Ana also admitted she checks certain groups throughout the day and is sure to keep on top of her emails - so that way the best offers can't be missed.
description: Ana Maria Macovei, 29, from Essex, has revealed she's received £1000 worth of goods for free - after signing up for offers and registering to product testing sites.
